greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of primes strictly between T(n) and T(n+1), where T(n) = n-th triangular number.
link: T. D. Noe, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
example: a(8)=3 because between T(8)=36 and T(9)=45 we have the prime numbers 37,41 and 43.
maple: a:= proc(n) local ct,j: ct:=0: for j from n*(n+1)/2+1 to (n+1)*(n+2)/2-1 do if isprime(j)=true then ct:=ct+1 else ct:=ct fi: od: end: seq(a(n),n=1..103); # _Emeric Deutsch_, Feb 23 2005
xref: Essentially the same as A065382 and A066888.
results.author: _Amarnath Murthy_, Jan 03 2004
